column2:
06:37 GMT
Jackie didn't need a wake-up call that morning. She was already on her way to Waterloo station by the time William was speeding down the M4.
The dashboard clock said 6.37 am. Town frowned, and checked his wristwatch, which blinked that it was 1.58 pm. Great, he thought. I was either up on that tree for eight hours, or for minus a minute.
